reaction.name: Endohydrolysis of (1->4)-alpha-D-glucosidic linkages in polysaccharides containing three or more (1->4)-alpha-linked D-glucose units.

texts.value: Binds to the sea anemone inhibitor helianthamide and magnificamide

The two forms of this enzyme, I and II, show very similar activities, molecular masses, and compositions and differ only in their isoelectric points. As no evidence for two variants were in the cDNA library of PubMed:10082956, it is most likely that isoform I (PPAI) and isoform II (PPAII) are two forms of the same protein
Belongs to the glycosyl hydrolase 13 family

citation.title: Molecular cloning and primary structure analysis of porcine pancreatic alpha-amylase.
Complete amino acid sequence and location of the five disulfide bridges in porcine pancreatic alpha-amylase.
Localization of the two free thiol groups in the porcine pancreatic alpha-amylase I sequence.
Magnificamide, a beta-defensin-like peptide from the mucus of the sea anemone Heteractis magnifica, is a strong inhibitor of mammalian alpha-amylases.
